item.title: Beogram 8000 Type 5613: Wisconsin project is ready for record play
item.description:
The Beogram 8000 turntable has undergone service manual checks and adjustments. The power supply voltages are within acceptable ranges, and the forward/reverse scanning LDR adjustments and tracking force are calibrated. A test play confirms the Beogram’s readiness for listening tests after component reinstallation. The supply voltage readings at the filter capacitors and regulator outputs are as follows: +15 VDC, -15 VDC, and +5 VDC. The forward and reverse scanning sensors (LDR devices) have been adjusted to an idle voltage of around 650 mVdc using a three-pin test connector...

item.title: Beogram 4002 Type 5513: First Listening Test
item.description:
I finished the mechanical adjustments on the Beogram today. After turning on my digital scale, I calibrated and locked the tonearm’s tracking force counterweight. Following Beolover’s method, I secured the calibrated setting by replacing the M3 counterweight adjustment screw on the back of the tonearm with a tightening nut. This prevents accidental changes during transport or handling. With the counterweight set, I secured the locking nut and added a touch of glue for extra stability...
